revised_title: Precise Location of Hydrogen Atoms in Complicated Structures Using Polarized Neutron Scattering
tldr: Researchers used polarized neutron scattering and dynamic nuclear polarization to precisely locate hydrogen atoms in a complex crystal structure. This technique, demonstrated using lanthanum magnesium nitrate hydrate, can potentially be applied to other crystals and may improve our understanding of complicated structures in biology, chemistry, and physics.
